abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rehabilitation and
            Institution Building Loan (IBL) Project for Belarus were as
            follows: for the IBL, the overall performance and outcome
            was fully satisfactory. Under the IBL, project
            funded-equipment, training and advisory services resulted in
            sustained improvements in performance in some of the
            agencies. Bank performance during both preparation and
            supervision was satisfactory, and illustrated that the
            projects were designed as quick response, initial
            relation-building projects. Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the Ministry of
            Finance suggested that disbursements for future adjustment
            loans be phased over time and linked to gradual progress in
            meeting targets set up and agreed on. This will provide more
            of a focus on economic reform as a process rather than an
            event, and provide more discipline in the implementation.
            Care should be taken to build consensus around the selection
            and implementation of policy conditionality between the Bank
            and the Government. The Government found that the long-term
            consultancy assignments were often more useful than the
            short-term ones. Short term assignments often did not allow
            the consultant(s) to develop the appropriate understanding
            of the Belarusian economy and often focused on too general
            advice and concepts. The originally envisaged energy and
            agriculture components of the Rehabilitation Loan did not
            materialize, and the funds were transferred to the Foreign
            Exchange component. Procurement of medicines was, therefore,
            the only remaining component for which the Bank's
            procurement rules applied. The Government feels that
            earmarking of funds for particular imports in Rehab-type
            projects should be carefully analyzed before the project
            starts, although the educational benefits of doing
            international procurement were significant.
